intro: Hieracium acosmodontum, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and often aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a composite head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium acosmodontum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
